Title: WAFCON: Nigeria beat Morocco to win record-extending 10th title
Summary: Substitute Jennifer Echegini scored the 88th-minute winner . Nigeria came from two goals behind to beat hosts Morocco 3-2 in the final . The triumph in Rabat confirmed the west Africans as the world champions .

Title: Female housemates unveiled for BBNaija Season 10
Summary: The reality television show Big Brother Naija has begun its 71-day journey of entertainment, game, rivalry, and drama . Over the last nine years, the show has featured 187 housemates and 10 fake housemates .

Title: Gaza civil defence says Israeli fire kills 40
Summary: Gaza’s civil defence agency said Israeli operations killed 40 people on Saturday . Civil defence spokesman Mahmud Bassal told AFP the dead included nine Palestinians killed in three separate incidents .

Title: 2030 World Cup: FIFA launches first N.African office in Morocco
Summary: FIFA inaugurated Saturday a regional office in Morocco — the first in North Africa and fifth in the continent . Morocco ramps up preparations for the 2030 World Cup which it will host jointly with Spain and Portugal .

Title: NANS decries student killings at AAUA, demands govt action
Summary: The National Association of Nigerian Students (NANS), Joint Campus Council, Ondo Axis, sounded a strong alarm over the harrowing wave of violence plaguing Adekunle Ajasin University, Akungba Akoko (AAUA) calling for swift government intervention .

Title: Musawa congratulates Super Falcons on historic WAFCON victory
Summary: Musawa congratulates Super Falcons on historic WAFCON victory . Minister of Art, Culture, Tourism, and the Creative Economy, Barrister Hannatu Musa Musawa has extended her warmest congratulations to the Super Falcons .

Title: Gov Mbah congratulates Super Falcons on historic 10th WAFCON title
Summary: Governor of Enugu State congratulates Super Falcons on historic 10th Women African Cup of Nations title . Dr. Peter Mbah said that they demonstrated the resilience of the Nigerian spirit .

Title: As another judge seeks to suffocate the people of Nigeria
Summary: Three different decisions of the highest court in the country over the past two decades illustrate how the judicial conspiracy against popular sovereignty in Nigeria has prospered .

Title: Sanwo-Olu congratulates Super Falcons on WAFCON triumph
Summary: Lagos State Governor, Babajide Sanwo-Olu, congratulates Nigeria's senior women’s football team, the Super Falcons, on their historic victory over Morocco . Nigeria won the 2025 Women's Africa Cup of Nations (WAFCON) on Saturday .

Title: Lagos doctors to embark on 3-day warning strike Monday
Summary: Medical doctors employed by the Lagos State Government have announced a three-day warning strike beginning 8:00 a.m. on Monday, July 28, 2025, in protest against what they described as an “illegal and disrespectful” salary deduction by the state government .

Title: LP not moved by defections, says acting chair Nenadi Usman
Summary: The acting National Chairman of the Labour Party, Senator Nenadi Usman, has downplayed the recent wave of defections from the party . She insisted that the LP remains strong and focused on providing a credible alternative to what she described as the “rudderless and visionless” administration of the All Progressives Congress .

Title: Oshodi urges NSC to invest in medal sports
Summary: Waheed Oshodi has urged the National Sports Commission to prioritise funding for sports that consistently yield medals at global competitions . Oshodi made the call during the WTT Contender Lagos finals, where local and international stars thrilled fans as the table tennis fest continues in Lagos . Sports such as table tennis, wrestling and athletics have delivered

Title: Injured Salgado thanks Falcons for support
Summary: Gabriela Salgado has expressed deep gratitude to Nigeria’s Super Falcons and the wider football community for the overwhelming support she received following the horrific leg injury she sustained . The 26-year-old fractured her left leg during South Africa's 2-1 semi-final loss to Nigeria last Tuesday in Casablanca, forcing her

Title: Okoronkwo stars as Falcons win 10th WAFCON title in Morocco
Summary: Esther Okoronkwo emerged as the heroine with one goal and two assists as Nigeria’s Super Falcons completed their ‘Mission X’ by winning a remarkable 10th TotalEnergies CAF Women's Africa Cup of Nations title . The Super Falcons staged an extraordinary second-half comeback to defeat hosts Morocco 3-

Title: 12 states vote N102bn for official lodge upgrade, SUVs
Summary: Lagos, Adamawa, Borno, Cross River, Delta, Ekiti, Imo, Jigawa, Kebbi, Ondo, Taraba, and Yobe . Funds cover modernisation and tech upgrades of government lodges and VIP suites .
